meanings.definition: a person who works compulsively and excessively
meanings.sent1: My brother is a workaholic, always staying late at the office to finish his projects.
meanings.sent2: The workaholic in our team never takes a break and is always the first one to arrive at work.
meanings.sent3: The workaholic forgot to eat lunch again because he was too focused on his work.
meanings.sent4: She was a true workaholic, her dedication to her job was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The workaholic's desk was always cluttered with papers and files, a sign of his constant dedication to work.

meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of a workaholic
meanings.sent1: Her workaholic behavior was evident in the long hours she spent at the office.
meanings.sent2: The workaholic culture in the company led to high productivity but also burnout among employees.
meanings.sent3: His workaholic tendencies sometimes made his friends joke that he was married to his job.
meanings.sent4: The workaholic nature of the project manager ensured that deadlines were always met.
meanings.sent5: The workaholic dedication of the team was commendable, but it also raised concerns about work-life balance.
